DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether new type soft contact lens unique optical design ( dual focus ) effective slow progression myopia ( near-sightedness ) child .
DOC.brief_title: An Evaluation Effectiveness Dual Focus Soft Contact Lenses Slowing Mypoia Progression
DOC.criteria: Be 8 12 year age inclusive . Bestcorrected visual acuity manifest refraction +0.10 logMAR . Spherical Equivalent Refractive Error 0.75 4.00 D inclusive astigmatism : < 0.75 D anisometropia : < 1.00 D Possess wearable visually functional eyeglass . Agree wear assign contact lenses minimum 10 hour per day , least 6 day per week , duration 3 year study . Subject previously currently wear contact lens rigid gas permeable contact lens , include orthokeratology lens . Subject currently within 30 day prior study active participant another clinical study . Current prior use bifocals , progressive addition lens , atropine , pirenzepine ANY myopia control treatment . Regular use ocular medication ( prescription overthecounter ) , artificial tear , wet agent . Current use systemic medication may significantly affect contact lens wear , tear film production , pupil size , accommodation refractive state . A known allergy fluorescein , benoxinate , proparacaine tropicamide . Strabismus cover test far ( 4 ) near ( 40 cm ) wear distance correction . Any ocular , systemic neurodevelopmental condition could influence refractive development .
